reviewText: Aamir Khan is good in whatever he decides to do. This movie offers great insight into the Partition of 1947 and the fallout that it caused. What is surprising is Aamir's character. Watch it and find out for yourself.
Actually I had not noticed that the film was not in English as was the video I already owned.  However, I love the film,so much that I am just happy to have it to watch.  Thankyou.
Very interesting, with some scenes that made my jaw drop! I liked it, but "Water" is still my very favorite in this trilogy, by a landslide.

I got this because my book club read "Cracking India" by Bepsi Sidhwa. It's a decent enough movie, I just thought there needed to be less gore and more explanation about the politics surrounding the Partition. I did learn a lot, however.
Melodramatic rubbish! But then again this is typical of indian cinema!

Complicated relationships-theme not clear.

I was in the dark on this one...could not appreciate this movie;  needs cultural understanding to me.
